page.title: 19Fingringhoe Nature Reserve.
page.content: This covers a wide area on the west side of the estuary about 2 miles from Colchester. The reserve is based on sandy soil and much had been developed for extraction of sand and gravel. Therefore, there are small lakes dotted about. The reserve runs down to the Colne Estuary with its distinctive salt marshes and mud flats. Thus there is a good variety of habitat. Hides have been built and there is primitive overnight accommodation. Several walks are signposted and there are printed guides. Open days are held to attract the general public.
